column1: full outside off, drives hard but straight to cover
length outside off, tries to blast it on the up but only manages to chop it

Short's back in the Australia squad but he's out of here! It was length around off, nipped back off the seam a touch, cut Short in half as he pushed outside the line and got an inside edge back to the keeper, gone for a three-ball duck
full outside off, pushed into the covers
that's full and wide and he does well to reach it with his hands and carve it over cover-point for the first boundary
length around off, some extra bounce, but well-watched and left alone
full and angled in, floated up a little, pushed to midwicket, a little bit early into the stroke
full around off, hint of that beautiful away swing, he pushes with his hands intending to go through the off side but gets an inside edge that takes the ball towards midwicket for two
length around off, stands tall and pushes it into the covers for one
right on target, length on around middle, cramping him for room, makes a little room and pushes it into the off side for one
full and straight, threatening to shape away, pushed to mid-on. Steyn wouldn't mind him playing against the swing from that line, great chance of an lbw, bowled or even a leading edge

that's a slower one, well disguised, Milenko presses forward and extends his arms looking for the ball, deceived by the slowness, but manages to clear long-on, just about and it trickles over the boundary, beating the chasing Maxwell
length around off, pushed through point for one
full and on the pads, flicked nicely but past midwicket but there's a wide long-on in place, he hurls a throw back, the keeper gets a nasty bounce, allowing an overthrow

length around off, he swings across the line with the bottom hand taking over, but gets a leading edge that flies over point and to third-man's right where Lamichhane seems to have done well to keep the ball in play with a well-timed slide
length outside off, skips down the wicket and makes room to blast that through the off side, but gave himself too much room and couldn't reach it, eventually

edged and down to third-man for four! excellent ball, length around off, extra bounce and a hint of seam away, takes the edge but it flies wide of the keeper. Definitely need a slip here with the carry on offer
beaten again, similar delivery, length outside off, extra lift and movement away, fishes with his hands staying very leg side and misses
short one and it hurries on to him, takes the helmet on the way to third man as he misses the pull shot, gets a leg bye
length outside off, throws his hands at it but it keeps a tad low to beat him on the inside edge
another short one, tennis ball like bounce, he stays leg side of the ball and takes his eyes off it, it keeps climbing and strikes him on the glove
short ball does the trick! It was coming at him, at good pace, tennis ball like bounce again as he attempted a pull only for the top edge to balloon up towards the keeper for a simple catch
another fast short one, it's not quite a bouncer but at a disconcerting chest height, defends awkwardly
full on the pads, slight anti climax, clipped to deep square leg for one
edged and short of slip, it was fullish around off, he pressed forward and went searching for it with his hands well in front, it nipped away slightly to take the outside edge but well short
overpitched from around the wicket, driven crisply but straight to cover
goes length again and he isn't comfortable there, followed him as he was making room, beats the outside edge, carrying nicely through
slightly fuller around off, pushed into the off side for one
another quick one that climbs on to the batsman and jams the finger on the handle as he defends
length around off, pushed into the off side and they come through for a quick single
length around middle, pressed forward and pushes it into the leg side
full outside off, half volley, caressed through the cover region for a couple to the sweeper's right
edged but wide of short third, length around off, attempts a cut but can't control the extra bounce, it was too close for the shot as well
length on off, pushed to cover
full on the pads, nudged into the leg side for one
full outside off, slider, pushed to deep cover for one
googly, tossed up around leg stump, out comes the reverse sweep but he can only tap it away to the leg side for one
googly again, goes back and picks it off the pitch, pushed into the leg side for one
another googly and nearly a catch to cover as he closes the face of the bat a bit early
length around off, cuts wide of point, not in full control because of the extra bounce but gets two
full on middle, pushed into the leg side for one
googly again, goes back and pushes it to wide long-on for a single
full and follows him a he skips down and pushes it past the bowler, the lack of timing actually allows them to convert what may have only been one into the two
that's better, comes down again, takes it on the full and drills it down the ground, beats the diving long-on to his left
quicker one, he goes back and defends
length around off, pushed into the off side
slightly short and wide outside off, cut hard to point's left but brilliantly done by Worrall diving to his left, saves four
length around off, pushed into the off side, dot again
tossed up on middle, swept along the ground to deep square leg
tossed up outside off, fetches it on the sweep and gets one to deep square leg
quicker one from the front of the hand, pushed into the off side
googly, lovely change up, really slow, he was down for the sweep but had to really wait and fetch it, gets one to deep square leg
length around off, pushed to long-on for one
googly, shorter, pitches middle and spins away with the batsman making room too early, manages to chop it away towards point for one
slower full one around off, squeezed into the off side for one
full around off, was shaping away in the air a little, another slower one, he wasn't quite there but chipped it down the ground with enough control for two

that's another one to the short ball! Banged it in, not particularly high, he was itching to come forward so had no control over the attempted pull, got it high on the bat and not nearly enough power behind it, easily taken at long-on
length on middle, shuffles a little and tucks it away to deep square leg for one
length outside off, extra bounce as he slashes and misses, quick one, carried through really well
short one at the body, too quick for Miller who is late on the pull and gloves it to the keeper
length on middle, makes room and has a slog, it hurries on to him and balloons up for the keeper to take the easiest of catches. Another one falls to the short one
length outside off, shuffles across and steers it to third-man's right for a couple
full and angled in to Bailey who was backing away, squeezes it away to deep cover for one
length and angled in, swung away to the leg side, didn't really get hold of it but enough for a couple to deep square leg's left
Yorker outside off with Faulkner backing away slightly, they come through for a quick bye  and it's also called wide
short one, follows him as Bailey makes room, but he keeps his shape as he lifts it between long-on and cow corner, couple of bounces and the fifth boundary of the innings

slower one, he swings but is through the shot too early, the keeper throws at the non striker's with Bailey looking to pinch a single, but that allows them to come through for the second with long-on having to come in to collect the keeper's throw
length and curving in slightly at middle stump. Check-pushes it out to mid-on off the front foot
big swing. Length and hooping a long way away outside off. Wide of the crease too, forced him to jab at that and be beaten

tough chance dropped at extra cover. Short and wide outside off, jabbed off the toe-end of the bat, floating to Clive Rose's right. He jumps backwards and full stretch with his right hand, can only manage to parry it towards sweeper
full on middle, tapped to mid-on

that looks plumb. Overpitched and coming in with the angle from off stump. He looks to drive for the one that straightens and is beaten big time on the inside edge. Feet are rooted to the crease and he's struck in front of middle

this looks good too! Superb from Faulkner. Swings a big one in again, from wide of the crease. He has completely ruined the batsmen so far with variations from where he's delivering the ball. This hoops in from off, beats his flick and catches him dead in front. Two sounds, but we'll have to wait and see if one of them was bat. He's on a hat-trick
yorker length at leg stump, jammed into the leg side

deflected off the bowler and past mid-off as it rolls out to the boundary. That must have caught the bone in his forearm because it sprinted away despite hitting him in the follow through. A length ball hammered back at him
full outswinger just outside off, driven to mid-off with no feet
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
nearly run out at the non-striker's end. Length ball just outside off, punched on the rise to mid-off. Takes him on and survives as the fielder can't get the direct hit
nicely timed. Full outside off, doesn't bother to get the front leg out and cramp himself. Stays still, offers the full face and drives it past the bowler
just clears point! Length ball slanted across the batsman. He reaches out and pushes with his hands. Gets a thick outside edge that just clears the infield
full slower ball just outside off, driven on the bounce to mid-off's left
length on middle stump, pulled aerially down to long-on
short of a length just outside off, punched to cover off his toes
appeal for catch behind. Short of a length ball jumps away from the surface as he shapes to punch that. He follows with his hands
carved over the off side! Short of a length and just outside off. Gets under that and cuts intentionally in the air. A couple of bounces into the boundary
dropped safely in front of point. Short of a length and sticking in the pitch as he looks to defend on the back foot. Lobs up off the shoulder of the bat
slashed wide of third man! Short ball in the corridor, backs into the leg side and uses the pace to cut firmly behind square
slower ball, short of a length at off stump. Mistimed pull to long-on's left

hits him right in the grille. Stoinis holds his hand up to say he's okay immediately, while he's still on the floor. He's up on his feet as fielders surround him to check on his health. Was looking to duck a short ball and that didn't quite rise as much as he expected. It's caught him on his way down. The team doctor is out to check on him. He's walking about, but he still looks dazed to me. Looks like he will continue batting. A new helmet has come out.
short of a length at off stump, gets behind this and drops it into the off side with soft hands
bouncer in the corridor, backs away and has a cut at it. Down to third man off the under-edge
short of a length on off, punched to long-on off the back foot
length outside off, punched to sweeper cover with the turn
full on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
fired down leg side. Attempted short ball, front of the hand and fired down leg. Wanted to follow the batsman, lost control entirely
short of a length in the corridor, punched to sweeper cover
short and wide and fast outside off. Beaten on the cut
short of a length just outside off, hurriedly punched to extra cover
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
slower ball at a length on off stump. Allows that to come on and drops it into the off side with soft hands
just wide of mid-off. Legcutter, slower ball outside off. Looks to drive on the rise, gets a thick edge to the fielder's right
short at middle stump, pushed into the leg side with soft hands
bouncer at leg stump, hooked uppishly down to fine leg
short of a length on off, clipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
full outside off, mistimed slog out to long-on's right
dropped short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket's right
full on middle, leans in and nudges into the vacant midwicket region
full on leg stump, clipped off the toe-end in front of long-on and they risk a second. Direct hit would have had him, but for now they clear the par score for the 7th over
short and down leg side, taken one-handed by the keeper
short and wide outside off, punched to sweeper cover
slapped over mid-off. Short of a length just outside off, stands deep in the crease and wallops that flat-batted
he's holed out to long-on! Sort of a length just outside off, looks to club that over midwicket, ends up slicing it and Miller hangs on
short at off stump, nicely on top of that to defend
